comments.body:
We should not have a new snapshot of each nightly
```
https://dotty.epfl.ch/0.22.0-bin-20200114-193f7de-NIGHTLY/...
https://dotty.epfl.ch/0.22.0-bin-20200115-aaaaaaa-NIGHTLY/...
https://dotty.epfl.ch/0.22.0-bin-20200116-bbbbbbb-NIGHTLY/...
...
```

Instead, we should replace the latest nightly documentation on each nightly release
```
https://dotty.epfl.ch/nightly/...
```

It looks like the simplest way is to do it in `project/scripts/genDocs` after doing `mv 0.*/ $PWD/docs/_site` we can rename `$PWD/docs/_site/0.22.0-bin-20200115-aaaaaaa-NIGHTLY` to `$PWD/docs/_site/nightly`
We should still set the `PATH` since some of our tests will invoke `javac` for example.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +65,69 @@    group: test
    image: lampepfl/dotty:2019-04-22
    commands:
      - export PATH="/usr/lib/jvm/java-11-openjdk-amd64/bin:$PATH"
      - cp -R . /tmp/6/ && cd /tmp/6/

comments.body: Are you sure this is the merged PR branch reference, as it was before?

@nicolasstucki From the log:
```
+ git fetch --no-tags origin $DRONE_COMMIT_REF
From https://github.com/lampepfl/dotty
 * branch                refs/pull/3432/merge -> FETCH_HEAD
```
http://dotty-ci.epfl.ch/lampepfl/dotty/1227

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +7,11 @@      - git init
      - git remote add origin $DRONE_REMOTE_URL
      - git fetch --no-tags origin $DRONE_COMMIT_REF
      - if [ $DRONE_BUILD_EVENT = "push" ]; then git reset --hard -q $DRONE_COMMIT_SHA; else git checkout -qf FETCH_HEAD; fi
      - git submodule update --init --recursive

comments.body: would be nice to comment why are those additional options needed.
True, also if it wasn't clear - they will be removed once we remove partest itself.
Is there an intention to remove partest before we merge this?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +35,39 @@matrix:
  TEST:
    - ;set testOptions in LocalProject("dotty-compiler") += Tests.Argument(TestFrameworks.JUnit, "--exclude-categories=dotty.tools.dotc.ParallelTesting") ;test ;dotty-bin-tests/test
    - ;set testOptions in LocalProject("dotty-compiler-bootstrapped") += Tests.Argument(TestFrameworks.JUnit, "--exclude-categories=dotty.tools.dotc.ParallelTesting") ;publishLocal ;dotty-bootstrapped/test
    - ;set testOptions in LocalProject("dotty-compiler") += Tests.Argument(TestFrameworks.JUnit, "--exclude-categories=dotty.tools.dotc.ParallelTesting") ;partest-only-no-bootstrap --show-diff --verbose

comments.body:
@DarkDimius - here you can see that partest is still included, with the new unit tests filtered out.

Once we want to remove partest from the CI these, lines dissappear and the only two left will be:

```yaml
- ;test ;dotty-bin-tests/test
- ;publishLocal ;dotty-bootstrapped/test
```

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +38,42 @@    - ;set testOptions in LocalProject("dotty-compiler-bootstrapped") += Tests.Argument(TestFrameworks.JUnit, "--exclude-categories=dotty.tools.dotc.ParallelTesting") ;publishLocal ;dotty-bootstrapped/test
    - ;set testOptions in LocalProject("dotty-compiler") += Tests.Argument(TestFrameworks.JUnit, "--exclude-categories=dotty.tools.dotc.ParallelTesting") ;partest-only-no-bootstrap --show-diff --verbose
    - ;set testOptions in LocalProject("dotty-compiler-bootstrapped") += Tests.Argument(TestFrameworks.JUnit, "--exclude-categories=dotty.tools.dotc.ParallelTesting") ;partest-only --show-diff --verbose
    - ;dotty-compiler/testOnly dotty.tools.dotc.CompilationTests
    - ;publishLocal ;dotty-bootstrapped/testOnly dotty.tools.dotc.CompilationTests
